description: High-performance C# Bulk operations for SQL Server (starting from 2008) and Azure SQL Database. Includes Data Table helper, Bulk Insert, Update, Delete & Merge. Uses SQLBulkCopy under the hood. See https://github.com/gtaylor44/SqlBulkTools for examples.
releaseNotes:
2.24
- "Overcome SqlBulkCopy Limitations". Output column direction for identity columns for all bulk operations. Slight performance hit of ~5% because SqlBulkCopy does not natively
support this feature. 
- RemoveColumn method available when using AddAllColumns(). This is useful when you want to include all
columns but exclude a couple. 
- Support for all .NET Framework type to SQL Server Data Type Mappings (<Value type>, Char[], String, Byte[], SqlXml).
- Bug fixes and performance enhancements. 
- Easily create data tables for usage in table types or temp tables.

2.02
- Fix for using SQL reserved keywords as column names. 

2.0 
- Locking to prevent concurrency. 
- New Feature: AddAllColumns(). All properties that are either value or string types are added. Saves time from having to manually add each column. You can still use the CustomColumnMapping method for any naming differences between your model and SQL table. 
- New Feature: TmpDisableAllNonClusteredIndexes() and AddTmpDisableNonClusteredIndex(string indexName). For making large changes, sometimes you might want to disable indexes temporarily to achieve optimal performance. 
- New Feature: WithSqlBulkCopyOptions(SqlBulkCopyOptions options). An enum internal to SqlBulkCopy to define customisable behaviour. It's possible to add a table lock via this option. 
- General optimisations. 
- More documentation. 

1.63 
Overloaded CommitTransaction for flexibility. CommitTransaction now accepts an SqlConnection object. 

1.6 
Introduced async version of CommitTransaction.
title: SqlBulkTools
